com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.currentout

Interface CurrentOut


  • public interface CurrentOut
    Interface for devices that have an Digital-Analog Converter (DAC). These devices read in counts and convert it to a volatge. Intended devices are the USB-LS450-4/20 and the USB-AOUT.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      USB-LS450s can be ordered with an optional 4-20mA analog output.

    • Method Detail

      • setDACCounts

        void setDACCounts(int counts)
           throws java.io.IOException
        USB-LS450s can be ordered with an optional 4-20mA analog output. This command sets the analog output on a USB-LS450-4/20 or a USB-AOUT. The analog output value is a 16-bit value that is linearly scaled between 4 and 20mA.

        Command the DAC to output at the specified level. The underlying commands are expected to be:

        • ADC1000: OP_DACWRITE (0x52)
        • HR2000+, HR4000, QE65000: OP_PSOCWRITE (0x69)
        • LS-450-AOUT: OP_SETDAVALUE (0x25)
        Parameters:
        counts - Number of counts to send to the DAC.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the plugin cannot communicate with the spectrometer.

      • getDACCounts

        java.lang.Integer getDACCounts()
        Get the current number of counts being sent to the DAC. The underlying device may not support this operation directly, so the value may be indeterminate, and a cached value may be returned.
        Returns:
        Integer containing the number of DAC counts, or null if the value is not known (as will be the case until getDACCounts() is first called).

      • getDACMinimum

        int getDACMinimum()
        Get the smallest number of counts that can legally be sent to getDACCounts()
        Returns:
        Number of counts

      • getDACMaximum

        int getDACMaximum()
        Get the largest number of counts that can legally be sent to getDACCounts()
        Returns:
        Number of counts

      • getDACIncrement

        int getDACIncrement()
        Get the step size for values that can be sent to getDACCounts(). This is intended to support SpinnerNumberModels.
        Returns:
        Step size for counts

      • analogOutCountsToMilliamps

        double analogOutCountsToMilliamps(int counts)
        Compute the approximate voltage that the DAC should output when set to a particular number of counts.
        Parameters:
        counts - Number of counts to convert
        Returns:
        Voltage (in volts) of the DAC for the given number of counts
